title: Introduction to melbWeather
text: vignette introduces melbWeather package, provides tools analyzing visualizing Melbourne’s weather data.

title: Introduction to melbWeather
text: Welcome melbWeather package! package designed help analyze visualize historical weather data Melbourne, Australia. provides functions exploring temperature trends, weather summaries, visualizations using daily minimum maximum temperatures. melbWeather package comes built-dataset called weather_data includes daily weather records Melbourne.

title: Introduction to melbWeather
text: install melbWeather package, use following command R console:
code: # Install the `remotes` package if you haven't already install.packages("remotes")  # Install the `melbWeather` package from GitHub remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2024/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-tdew0002")

title: Introduction to melbWeather
text: package installed, load :

title: Introduction to melbWeather
text: vignette introduces melbWeather package, provides tools analyzing visualizing Melbourne’s weather data.

title: Introduction to melbWeather
text: Use functions melbWeather package explore temperature trends:
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(weather_data, aes(x = date, y = minimum_temperature_degree_c)) +   geom_line() +   labs(title = "Minimum Temperatures in Melbourne")

title: Introduction to melbWeather
text: melbWeather package also includes interactive Shiny app exploring weather data. launch Shiny app, use following function: Shiny app provides interactive controls filter data date range temperature type, making easy visualize trends explore dataset detail.

title: melbWeather
text: melbWeather package provides tools analyze visualize Melbourne’s weather data, including minimum maximum temperature trends time. designed students analysts looking explore temperature patterns user-friendly way using R Shiny.

text: can install development version melbWeather GitHub : GitHub :

title: melbWeather
text: basic example demonstrates use melbWeather package load data launch interactive Shiny app:
code: library(melbWeather)  # Load Melbourne weather data data("weather_data")  # Display the first few rows of the data head(weather_data)

title: melbWeather
text: explore Melbourne’s weather data interactively, can launch Shiny app included package:

title: melbWeather
text: example summarising basic dataset: can also embed plots, example: case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: summary(weather_data$minimum_temperature_degree_c) library(ggplot2) ggplot(weather_data, aes(x = as.Date(paste(year, month, day, sep = "-")), y = minimum_temperature_degree_c)) +   geom_line(color = "#005b96") +   labs(     title = "Minimum Temperature Trend in Melbourne",     x = "Date",     y = "Temperature (°C)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: melbWeather
text: Installation: Provides instructions installing package using pak, simplifies installation development versions GitHub. Vignette Section: Added new section titled Vignettes instructions access vignette: Usage: Shows load package, access data, use core function (startApp()). Launch Shiny App: Mentions use interactive Shiny app, encouraging users explore data visually. Example Analysis: Includes examples showcase dataset plots, giving users clear idea can achieve package. License: Standard sections encourage contributions clarify package’s license.

title: Clean Melbourne Weather Data — clean_weather_data
text: Merges cleans Melbourne weather data minimum maximum temperature files.

title: Clean Melbourne Weather Data — clean_weather_data
text: min_data_path path minimum temperature CSV file. max_data_path path maximum temperature CSV file.

title: Clean Melbourne Weather Data — clean_weather_data
text: cleaned data frame columns: year, month, day, minimum_temperature_degree_c, maximum_temperature_degree_c.

what: Launch the Melbourne Temperature Shiny App — startApp
title: Launch the Melbourne Temperature Shiny App — startApp
text: function launches Shiny app exploring Melbourne temperature data.

title: Launch the Melbourne Temperature Shiny App — startApp
Melbourne Weather Data — weather_data
text: dataset containing daily minimum maximum temperatures Melbourne 2013 2024.

title: Melbourne Weather Data — weather_data
text: data frame columns: year Year observation (integer). month Month observation (integer). day Day observation (integer). minimum_temperature_degree_c Minimum temperature degrees Celsius (numeric). maximum_temperature_degree_c Maximum temperature degrees Celsius (numeric).

title: Melbourne Weather Data — weather_data
text: Bureau Meteorology, Australia
